00020 #define kAlphaOffset 55
00021 #define kNumericOffset 48
00022 #define kModulus 43
00023 #define kASCII "ascii"
00024 
00025 using namespace std;
00026 using namespace rapidxml;
00027 
00028 Code39::Code39( string *data )
00029 {
00030         BaseBarcode::setCheckcharModulus( kModulus );
00031         filename = "Basic.xml";
00032         parsed_xml.parse< 0 >( getXMLToParse( &filename ) );
00033         setDataLength( -1 ); //variable length symbol
00034         //verify
00035         if ( verifyData( data ) )
00036         {
00037                 //data
00038                 encodeSymbol( data );
00039                 //check char
00040                 encodeCheckCharacter( data );
00041                 //start/stop
00042                 encodeStartStop( );
00043                 //quiet zones
00044                 encodeQuietZones( ); 
00045         }
00046         else 
00047         {
00048                 cerr << "Data verification failed" << endl;
00049         }
00050 }

00055

00059 bool Code39::verifyContent ( const string *content )
00060 {
00061         //** setup acceptable content **
00062         string ASCIIstring = "$%* +-./0123456789ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ";
00063         set< char > setOfASCII;
00064         set< char > ::iterator iter;
00065         for ( int nn = 0; nn < ASCIIstring.length( ); nn++ ) 
00066         {
00067                 setOfASCII.insert( ASCIIstring.at( nn ) );
00068         }
00069         //** check the incoming string **
00070         for ( int nn = 0; nn < content->length( ); nn++ ) 
00071         {
00072                 iter = setOfASCII.find( content->at( nn ) );
00073                 if (iter == setOfASCII.end( ) ) 
00074                 {
00075                         cerr << "You are trying to encode " << content->at( nn ) << " which is not supported by this barcode type." << endl;
00076                         return false;
00077                 }
00078         }
00079         return true;   
00080 }

00083 void Code39::encodeSymbol ( const string *data )
00084 {
00085         xml_node< > *node = NULL;
00086         
00087         //** make an array of the ascii value of each char in the string **
00088         const string *incomingString = data;
00089         int stringLength = incomingString->length( );
00090         int asciiList[ stringLength ];
00091         
00092         //** loop thru the data and fill the array with its ascii values. **
00093         for ( int ii = 0; ii < stringLength; ii++ ) 
00094         {
00095                 unsigned char eachChar = incomingString->at( ii );
00096                 asciiList[ ii ] = ( int )eachChar;
00097         }
00098         
00099         for ( int jj = 0; jj < stringLength; ++jj ) 
00100         {
00101                 string firstBit = kASCII;
00102                 int kk = asciiList[ jj ];
00103                 string secondBit;
00104                 stringstream out;
00105                 out << kk;
00106                 secondBit = out.str( );
00107                 out.flush( );
00108                 firstBit.append( secondBit );
00109                 
00110                 string ASCIIRef = kASCII;
00111                 string returnedData;
00112                 
00113                 node = parsed_xml.first_node( )->first_node( )->next_sibling( "data_encoding" )->first_node( firstBit.c_str( ) )->first_node( "Code39" );
00114                 returnedData = node->value( );
00115                 vector< int > *pattern = stringToVector( returnedData );
00116                 
00117                 Symbol *aSymbol = createSymbol( 0, 1, 1, 0, pattern ); 
00118                 BaseBarcode::addEncodedSymbol( aSymbol );
00119                 
00120                 delete pattern;
00121         }
00122 }

00125 void Code39::encodeStartStop ( )
00126 {
00127         string returnedData;
00128         xml_node< > *node = parsed_xml.first_node( )->first_node( )->next_sibling( "non_data_encoding" )->first_node( "start_char" )->first_node( "Code39" );
00129         returnedData = node->value( );
00130         
00131         vector< int > *pattern = stringToVector( returnedData );
00132         
00133         Symbol *startstopSymbol = createSymbol( 4, 1, 1, 0, pattern );
00134         BaseBarcode::addEncodedSymbol( startstopSymbol, 0 );
00135         BaseBarcode::addEncodedSymbol( startstopSymbol, BaseBarcode::encodedSymbols.size( ) );
00136 }

00138 
00139 void Code39::encodeQuietZones ( )
00140 {
00141         string returnedData;
00142         xml_node< > *node = parsed_xml.first_node( )->first_node( )->next_sibling( "non_data_encoding" )->first_node( "quietzone_left" )->first_node( "Code39" );
00143         returnedData = node->value( );
00144         
00145         int width = atoi( returnedData.c_str( ) );
00146         vector< int > *pattern = new vector< int >;
00147         pattern->push_back( width );
00148         
00149         Symbol *quietSymbol = createSymbol( 2, 1, 1, 0, pattern );
00150         BaseBarcode::addEncodedSymbol( quietSymbol, 0 );
00151         BaseBarcode::addEncodedSymbol( quietSymbol, BaseBarcode::encodedSymbols.size( ) );
00152 }

00154 
00155 void Code39::encodeCheckCharacter ( const string *data )
00156 {
00157         int accumulator = 0;
00158         for ( int bb = 0; bb < data->length( ); bb++ ) 
00159         {
00160                 char aChar = data->at( bb );
00161                 int returnedINT = checksumIntForChar( aChar );
00162                 accumulator = accumulator + returnedINT;
00163         }
00164         
00165         int modulo = accumulator % BaseBarcode::getCheckcharModulus( );
00166         char returnChar = checksumCharForInt( modulo );
00167         
00168         xml_node< > *node = NULL;
00169         
00170         //**int to string using streams - inefficient but standard**
00171         string returnedData;
00172         string firstBit = kASCII;
00173         string secondBit;
00174         stringstream out;
00175         out << ( int )returnChar;
00176         secondBit = out.str( );
00177         out.flush( );
00178         firstBit.append( secondBit );
00179         
00180         node = parsed_xml.first_node( )->first_node( )->next_sibling( "data_encoding" )->first_node( firstBit.c_str( ) )->first_node( "Code39" );
00181         returnedData = node->value( );
00182         vector< int > *pattern = stringToVector( returnedData );
00183         
00184         Symbol *aSymbol = createSymbol( 1, 1, 1, 0, pattern ); 
00185         BaseBarcode::addEncodedSymbol( aSymbol, BaseBarcode::encodedSymbols.size( ) );
00186         
00187         delete pattern;
00188 }

00190 
00191 vector< int >* Code39::stringToVector( string aString )
00192 {
00193         vector< int > *pattern = new vector< int >;
00194         for ( int ll = 0; ll < aString.length( ) ; ll++ )
00195         {
00196                 char eachCharFromResult = aString.at( ll );
00197                 int temp = atoi( &eachCharFromResult );
00198                 temp++; //** to bring it up to standard 1 for narrow, 2X...NX for wide **
00199                 pattern->push_back( temp );
00200         }
00201         return pattern;
00202 }
00203 
00204 int Code39::checksumIntForChar( int aChar )
00205 {
00206         if ( isdigit( ( char )aChar ) ) 
00207         {
00208                 return aChar - kNumericOffset;
00209         } 
00210         else if ( isalpha( aChar ) ) 
00211         {
00212                 return ( int )aChar - kAlphaOffset;
00213         }
00214         else 
00215         {
00216                 switch ( aChar ) 
00217                 {
00218                         case ' ':
00219                                 return 38;
00220                                 break;
00221                         case '$':
00222                                 return 39;
00223                                 break;
00224                         case '%':
00225                                 return 42;
00226                                 break;
00227                         case '+':
00228                                 return 41;
00229                                 break;
00230                         case '-':
00231                                 return 36;
00232                                 break;
00233                         case '.':
00234                                 return 37;
00235                                 break;
00236                         case '/':
00237                                 return 40;
00238                                 break;
00239                         default:
00240                                 break;
00241                 }
00242         }
00243         return 0;
00244 }
00245 
00246 
00247 char Code39::checksumCharForInt( int anInt )
00248 {
00249         if ( anInt >= 0 && anInt <= 9 ) 
00250         {
00251                 return anInt + kNumericOffset;
00252         } 
00253         else if ( anInt >= 10 && anInt <= 35 ) 
00254         {
00255                 return anInt + kAlphaOffset;
00256         }
00257         else 
00258         {
00259                 switch ( anInt ) {
00260                         case 36:
00261                                 return 45;
00262                                 break;
00263                         case 37:
00264                                 return 46;
00265                                 break;
00266                         case 38:
00267                                 return 32;
00268                                 break;
00269                         case 39:
00270                                 return 36;
00271                                 break;
00272                         case 40:
00273                                 return 47;
00274                                 break;
00275                         case 41:
00276                                 return 43;
00277                                 break;
00278                         case 42:
00279                                 return 37;
00280                                 break;
00281                         default:
00282                                 break;
00283                 }
00284         }
00285         return 0;
00286 }
